summary: The "Final Determination" tag refers to notifications issued by the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) regarding the release status of specific records related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll. These notifications primarily address the postponement of releasing Social Security numbers from HSCA staff payroll records to protect personal privacy. The documents indicate a consistent pattern of balancing public access to assassination-related records with the need to safeguard individual privacy rights. The ARRB's role was to review and determine the release status of assassination-related materials, and these final determinations represent their decisions regarding specific HSCA payroll records.
significance: In the context of the JFK assassination, "Final Determination" notifications highlight the ARRB's efforts to balance transparency and privacy when releasing historical records. Specifically, these determinations address the release of HSCA staff payroll records, demonstrating the ARRB's role in managing access to information related to the investigation of the assassination while protecting personal information.
